revised_title: Ultra-Violet Micrography of Metals and Alloys
tldr: The authors explore the potential of using ultra-violet radiation to improve the resolution of microstructures in metals and alloys. They test the method on a series of metals and alloys, comparing the results with those obtained using visual light systems. The study demonstrates that ultra-violet radiation can provide higher resolution of metal microstructures, opening up new possibilities for research in materials science and metallurgy.
